Part A: Describe one feature of Afrofuturism.

Examples that earn this point include but are not limited to the following:

  • Afrofuturism reimagines Black pasts, such as a past without oppression.

  • Afrofuturism envisions Afrocentric futures using technology and science.

  • Afrofuturism imagines the liberation of Black people around the world in the future.

  • Afrofuturism promotes a more empowered image of people of African descent.

The response accomplishes the task set by part A of the question.

Part B: Describe one context that shaped the development of Afrofuturism.

Examples that earn this point include but are not limited to the following:

  • Afrofuturism’s characteristic works emerged from the Black Arts movement of the 1970s, which encouraged distinct expressions of culture.

  • Afrocentricity places Africa and the achievements of people of African descent at the center of history.

  • Nichelle Nichols as Uhura in the 1960s television program Star Trek provided an image of African Americans in space. She became a role model for many Black people and later helped recruit Black astronauts for NASA.

  • The anti-colonial and independence movements of African nations in the 1960s and 1970s were influential to the development of Afrofuturism.

The response accomplishes the task set by part B of the question.

Part C: Formulate a claim that summarizes the significance of Afrofuturism.

Examples that earn this point include but are not limited to the following:

  • Afrofuturism uses art to explore how the Black community could have been by imaging a Black past without oppression.

  • Afrofuturism utilizes creative expression to explore boundless new possibilities for Black people.

  • Afrofuturism provides empowerment for Black people with the portrayal of Black heroes in stories and films.

  • Afrofuturism gives an expansive and positive vision of the Black experience.

Part D: Explain how the discipline of African American Studies differs from more traditional academic disciplines.

Examples that earn this point include but are not limited to the following:

  • Instead of scholars just focusing on one discipline like history, African American Studies provides an interdisciplinary approach to the study of Black life and culture.

  • The field analyzes Black history, literature, politics, and other subjects not included in more traditional disciplines.

  • While a discipline like history typically focuses only on the past, African American Studies examines the past, present, and future of Black experiences in the United States.
